title: Yasuo Players
body: One thing that tilts me is that everyone assumes all Yasuo players are league's worst people. It's not fair that I get judged just because of the champion I love to main and I get told to kill myself. It's ridiculous I even have to say this. I've met a lot of cool and nice yasuo players, including myself. Remember that everyone that plays this game is an actual person sitting on the opposite side of that computer screen. And what you say actually may have an effect on that particular person.

Your view is pretty one-sided.

It's a team game, not helping a team mate or forcing him to wait for you to do something that could be useful for them and limiting their decision making by your own comforts is just stupid. Yasuo then could use his Wind Wall just for him following your logic because he doesn't have to be forced to waste his defensive CD when you could have just walked away.

I find it so funny that many generalize "EVERY x player is awful!" 

They're not.

You've had games where they are good, and friendly, except you don't remember them.

You don't remember them because they don't fit into your pre-defined frame of what a certain champ player should be like, so you forget them. 

However, by the gods, should you encounter a player that _does_ fit into your pre-defined frame, you're the first one to flame them and accuse them of being "just another x player."

Confirmation bias at its clearest.

I've just had a few straight draft games of horribly toxic Yasuo players. I just dodged a game where a player tilted out of control in champ select because I banned Yasuo (because the other team was picking first and Yasuo is picked every game if not banned). He declared he would be reporting me for banning Yasuo and apparently was in a pre-made with my support (I was ADC) and encouraged him to pick a troll support just to punish me for banning Yasuo. And the other team banned Yasuo too anyway. Obviously I dodged because I should not be forced into a 40+ minute prison with such horrible people.

Sure, maybe not all Yasuo players are League's worst people. But most of League's worst people are Yasuo players. It sucks for the decent Yasuo players, but a lot of us are aggressive only because we've been tilted by most every Yasuo we see in game.

To help you notice more and believe others that Yasuo mains aren't bad people.

I'm a Yasuo main because I love the lore, a wandering samurai branded as the Unforgiven.  The voice actor is one of my favorites from watching different kinds of anime he's ever been a cast in, I love his VO lines especially when he's constantly moving and my favorite one is of course "Sorye Ge Ton!" :D but do not get me started on his Nightbringer VOs :P "I will not be tamed!" All in all, the character, the kit, the lore, the voice, it all fits in a nice package and I'm proud to call myself a Yasuo main, first champ I've hit Level 7 Mastery, Second Penta Kill champ, I only have 142k mastery points on him which is not a lot (Too much Xin and Nasus games xD) but I really appreciate the time I put into learning him.  

TL;DR I love my champion not just because of his kit but because of the story around his past and how he carries himself.  I respect Yasuo's creator as well as Liam for voicing him.  They can update and change his kit if they want, but it won't stop me from playing him because as I said I love the lore, the character as a whole.

One thing is 100% truth in my case:
My Yasuo is feeding his ass off/"having a bad game", their Yasuo is always winning with an absurd score. I never allow Yasuo ban to not go through for this reason alone. I don't think Yasuo is a bad champion but whenever someone picks him in my team, they never go for crit + damage builds that's going to win them the game, they wan't some absurd half tanky, bruiser build that was nerfed months ago.

So the only way they are picking Yasuo is probably because since he's popular, they think he's broken or freelo so they play him without even knowing how to do so properly.
